results.title: Marketing the myths
results.brief_description: This film is a presentation of the best of four hundred television commercials submitted in a competition. Aims to assist in the study of television advertising and its influence on modern society and culture.

results.title: Marketing in action
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Marketing”.
An account of the competition (suitably cut-throat) in the shaving market over the past few years. taking part are the top marketing men of the razor-blade and electric shaver industries. Wet versus dry, stainless verus non-stainless, Davids versus Goliaths. They form an ideal framework for an introduction to modern marketing in action.

results.title: Market town
results.brief_description: A film about market day in an old Nottinghamshire town. The roads leading to the town are full of traffic, for the country people are bringing their cattle, poultry, fruit and vegetables and other farm produce to market. At the market, farmers show each other sample of grain, crowd the cattle market, and sit about talking of the weather and the prices of the crops - the subject farmers everywhere talk about.

results.title: Market of dreams
results.brief_description: With little understanding of the meanings or the origins of Australian Aboriginal art, the international art market has eagerly, almost obscenely, embraced this most ancient cultural tradition. This significant, ironic documentary does not presume to make judgements on the artists and the analysts, the prophets and the profiteers, the critics and collectors. The images and stories speak for themselves. Features artists, Ronnie Tjampitjinpa, Michael Jagamara Nelson, Darby Jampijinpa, Dolly Nampijinpo Granites, Uta Uta Tjangala and Turkey Tolson Tjupurrlo. Gold Medal Winner, International Film & Television Festival, New York, 1991.

results.title: Marked woman
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Louis F. Edelman, Hal B Wallis, Jack L. Warner and Lloyd Bacon
results.brief_description: A hard boiled B-girl (Bette Davis), is determined to turn the tables on Mobster Johnny Vanning (Eduardo Ciannelli), who has recently taken over the management of the nightclub where she works and is attempting to turn out the current employees. It proves to be hard task for one individual so she enlists the help of a district attorney (Bogart), and her fellow workers at the nightclub (Rosalind Marquis, Lola Lane, Isabel Jewell and Mayo Methot). This film is based on the trial of New York Gangster Lucky Luciano, sent to prison on the basis of evidence from prostitutes.
